title: NumPy: Boolean Indexing
story: Boolean indexing lets you filter arrays based on conditions. It's a powerful technique for data filtering.
instructions: Create array [15, 8, 23, 12, 30, 5]. Use boolean indexing to extract only values greater than 10 and print them.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

# Create array and filter
arr = np.array([15, 8, 23, 12, 30, 5])
filtered = arr[arr > 10]
print(filtered)
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np

arr = np.array([15, 8, 23, 12, 30, 5])
filtered = arr[arr > 10]
print(filtered)

hints.text: Use arr[arr > 10] to filter. The condition creates a boolean mask.
arr > 10 creates [True, False, True, True, True, False], which selects matching elements.
